snippet: A federal judge has temporarily blocked enforcement of Louisiana’s new abortion law that requires doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges to a hospital within 30 miles of their clinics.
abstract: Federal Judge John W deGravelles in Louisiana temporarily blocks enforcement of state's restrictive new abortion laws; rules that law can still take effect but doctors or clinics breaking it while challenge is heard cannot be penalized.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge has temporarily blocked enforcement of Louisiana’s new abortion law that requires doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges to a hospital within 30 miles of their clinics.

headline.main: Judge Blocks Abortion Law in Louisiana
headline.print_headline: Judge Blocks Abortion Law in Louisiana
